title: Angie Kent says she's 'more relatable' than former Bachelorettes as she's a 'normal gal'
text:
She's set to search for love on the upcoming reason of the Bachelorette.

And Angie Kent believes she will be 'more relatable' than former Bachelorettes like Sophie Monk and Ali Oetjen.

Speaking to PopSugar, the 29-year-old said she had reservations about taking on the dating series.

'I'm no stunning Sophie Monk or stock standard beautiful Ali Oetjen': Angie Kent (pictured) told PopSugar this week that she's 'more relatable' than former Bachelorettes

'I did think that I'm no stunning Sophie Monk or stock-standard beautiful Ali. But I think that's what makes me more relatable, that I am like the girl next door,' she said.

She added: 'We all have our ups and downs and I'm very open about that. I think it's good for Australia to see just a normal-ish gal looking for love.'

It comes after Angie was forced to defend her changing appearance.

She told the publication: 'I did think that I'm no stunning Sophie Monk or stock standard beautiful Ali,' she said. Pictured right: Ali Oetjen and left: Sophie Monk

She added: 'I think that's what makes me more relatable, that I am like the girl next door. I think it's good for Australia to see just a normal-ish gal looking for love'

She has made no secret of her cosmetic enhancements, including the fact she has undergone Botox injections in the past.

But Angie has insisted she steered clear of getting any additional work done in preparation for her appearance on The Bachelorette.

'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told NW magazine.

Looking different? It comes after Angie was forced to defend her changing appearance.'I've had the same work for the last four years, but all of a sudden everyone is saying I've changed my face for the show,' she told NW magazine

Same face! 'That's 100 per cent not true. I've just lost weight, no extra work,' the former Gogglebox star added

'That's 100 per cent not true. I've just lost weight, no extra work,' the former Gogglebox star added.

In an interview with NW magazine on Monday, Angie revealed she had found love, confessing she was 'very, very happy'.

And she admitted she didn't have a particular type, claiming she is 'attracted to someone's smile and their spirit'.
description: She's set to search for love on the upcoming reason of the Bachelorette.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
